title: Job Vacancies at Trusted Choice Assets Limited
content:
Trusted Choice Assets Limited is a 21st century real estate company with her presence in different states of the federation. Our head office is at Ikeja Lagos State.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Graphics Assistant

Job Location: Ogba - Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Create engaging graphics for online and offline marketing campaigns
	Design content for social media, flyers, brochures, and presentations
	Collaborate with the content and marketing teams to bring ideas to life
	Maintain brand consistency across all designs
	Handle basic video editing or animations.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND qualification with 1 - 5 years of work experience in the related field.
	Proficiency in design tools like Canva, Photoshop, capcut CorelDRAW, or similar
	Creativity and attention to detail
	Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines
	Strong communication and teamwork skills
	Prior experience in a similar role is an advantage.


Salary
N100,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@trustedassetsng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Account Officer

Job Location: Ogba, Ikeja - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Account Officer to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing financial records, handling transactions, preparing reports, and supporting overall financial operations in line with company policies.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage bank reconciliations and daily financial transactions.
	Process accounts payable and receivable accurately and on time.
	Prepare commissions
	Maintain up-to-date financial records and reports.
	Advise on investment portfolios and support financial decision-making.
	Handle tax and audit activities as required.
	Conduct financial analysis and prepare monthly reports for management.
	Support inter-departmental operations with financial insights.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or related field.
	Minimum of 1–2 years of relevant experience (real estate sector experience is an added advantage).
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, tax regulations, and audit processes.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
	Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.
	High level of integrity and accountability.





Remuneration


	Salary: N100,000 Monthly.
	Competitive salary.


Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@trustedassetsng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Site Manager

Job Location: Ogba, Ikeja - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are looking for an experienced Site Manager to oversee and coordinate our real estate project sites.


Requirements


	HND / B.Sc in Civil Engineering, Building Technology, or related field.
	2 - 5 years of proven experience managing construction/real estate sites.
	Strong leadership, organizational & problem-solving skills.
	Must know how to drive & ensure project delivery on time.


Renumeration
Attractive Salary (N150,000 monthly) + Benefits.

Application Closing Date: 25th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@trustedassetsng.com using “Site Manager” as the subject of the email.

title: Job Vacancies at Ankor Pointe Integrated Limited
content:
Ankor Pointe Integrated Limited is an Indigenous Oil and Gas Services company and an end-to-end solution provider in the oil and gas industry. We specialize in providing Integrated Field Studies, Well Services and Production Solutions, Project Management and Technical Advisory Services, Surface and Subsurface Engineering, Asset Management, and Turnkey Solutions to the Nigerian Upstream Oil and Gas Industry.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Chief Financial Officer (CFO)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a strategic, results-driven, and experienced Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to join our executive leadership team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing all financial aspects of the business and driving the company’s financial strategy and planning.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide leadership and direction to the finance and accounting teams.
	Oversee budgeting, forecasting, cash flow, and financial reporting.
	Develop and implement financial strategies aligned with business objectives.
	Ensure compliance with statutory laws, tax regulations, and internal policies.
	Drive financial planning, risk management, and investment analysis.
	Engage with external stakeholders including auditors, banks, and regulatory bodies.
	Support executive management with actionable insights for decision-making.
	Lead funding and capital structuring initiatives as needed.


Requirements


	A Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field; an MBA is an added advantage.
	A minimum of 10 years of progressive experience in finance, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role., as a CFO
	Professional certification (e.g., ACA, ACCA, CPA) is required.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian financial regulations and global accounting standards.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Proven experience in strategy, financial modeling, and executive reporting.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
	Must be available to resume immediately.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@ankorpointe.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail. 

 


2.) Siesmic Interpreter

Job Location: Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Seismic Interpreter to join our geoscience team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for interpreting seismic data to support exploration, field development, and reservoir characterization efforts.
	This role is critical in identifying subsurface structures and potential hydrocarbon reservoirs.


Key Responsibilities


	Interpret 2D and 3D seismic datasets to generate structural and stratigraphic maps
	Integrate seismic interpretation with well data, geological models, and petrophysical data
	Identify and map potential hydrocarbon traps and prospects
	Provide geophysical input to reservoir models and drilling plans
	Participate in prospect evaluation, risk assessment, and volumetric estimation
	Work collaboratively with geologists, reservoir engineers, and drilling teams
	Prepare and present technical reports and recommendations to internal and external stakeholders
	Stay updated on advancements in seismic processing and interpretation technologies.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Geophysics, Geology, Earth Sciences, or a related field
	Minimum of 8 years of relevant industry experience in seismic interpretation
	Strong proficiency in interpretation software such as Petrel, Kingdom, or similar tools
	Solid understanding of seismic acquisition and processing principles
	Experience with both exploration and field development projects
	Strong analytical, communication, and presentation skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Experience working in [deepwater, onshore, frontier, etc. – customize based on your operation]
	Familiarity with quantitative interpretation and seismic inversion techniques
	Exposure to machine learning or AI tools in geoscience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@ankorpointe.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail. 

 


3.) Business Development Officer

Job Locations: Lagos and Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking a results-driven and experienced Business Development Manager to lead and expand our growth efforts within the oil and gas sector.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, managing client relationships, and driving strategic partnerships across upstream, midstream, or downstream operations.
	This role is ideal for someone with deep industry knowledge, a strong network, and a passion for building long-term commercial value in the energy space.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute a business development strategy focused on growth within the oil and gas industry
	Identify and pursue new business opportunities in upstream, midstream, or downstream markets
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including IOCs, NOCs, service companies, and regulators
	Lead proposal development, contract negotiations, and deal closure
	Monitor industry trends, competitor activity, and market shifts to identify areas of opportunity
	Represent the company at industry conferences, exhibitions, and networking events
	Collaborate with internal teams (technical, finance, legal, operations) to ensure successful project delivery
	Maintain a robust sales pipeline and report regularly on progress against targets


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Geosciences, Business, or related field (MBA is a plus)
	Minimum of 7–10 years of business development experience in the oil and gas industry
	Strong understanding of the energy value chain (exploration, production, services, or infrastructure)
	Proven track record of winning and closing deals within the sector
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills
	Self-starter with the ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities
	Strong network and relationships within the oil and gas industry is a strong advantage


Preferred Skills:


	Experience working with or selling to IOCs/NOCs
	Technical background or ability to understand complex oil and gas solutions


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@ankorpointe.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Openings at FF Trading Services Limited
content:
FF Trading Services Limited is a leading provider of high-quality medical and laboratory equipment, dedicated to advancing healthcare and scientific research. With a commitment to innovation and excellence, we specialize in supplying cutting-edge products to medical facilities, laboratories, and research institutions worldwide.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales Engineer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are expanding and seeking skilled professionals in management, marketing & sales, and communications.
	Are you technically inclined with a passion for solving client problems? We're looking for a driven Sales Engineer to help bridge the gap between complex medical technology and customer needs.


Key Responsibilities


	Present and demonstrate medical equipment and solutions to clients.
	Provide technical support before and after sales.
	Develop and maintain relationships with hospitals, clinics, and distributors.
	Collaborate with engineering and product teams to deliver client-focused solutions.
	Prepare detailed proposals, quotations, and documentation.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (Biomedical, Electrical, Mechanical) or related field.
	12+ years of relevant work experience.
	Strong technical knowledge of medical devices or healthcare technology.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and customer relationship skills.
	Previous experience in technical sales or healthcare is an advantage.
	Must be based in, or willing to relocate to, Abuja.


Why Join Us


	Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits
	Opportunity to grow within a thriving and meaningful industry
	Be part of a professional and innovative team
	Make a direct impact in transforming healthcare delivery.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief Cover letter to: info@fftrading.biz using Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Marketing Officer

Job Locations: Abuja & Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are expanding and seeking skilled professionals in management, marketing & sales, and communications.
	At FF trading services ltd., we specialize in providing high-quality medical equipment and solutions to healthcare providers across Nigeria.
	We are looking for Marketing Officers – Lagos & Abuja.


Key Responsibilities


	Execute local marketing strategies and campaigns
	Conduct market research and build client relationships
	Organize promotional events and represent the brand regionally
	Collaborate with the sales team to support business goals.


Requirements


	Degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field
	Experience in field marketing or regional sales is a plus
	Highly organized, energetic, and result-oriented
	Must reside in, or be willing to relocate to, Lagos or Abuja.


Why Join Us?


	Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits
	Opportunity to grow within a thriving and meaningful industry
	Be part of a professional and innovative team
	Make a direct impact in transforming healthcare delivery.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: info@fftrading.biz using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Social Media & Communications Officer

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) and Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are expanding and seeking skilled professionals in management, marketing & sales, and communications. At FF trading services ltd., we specialize in providing high-quality medical equipment and solutions to healthcare providers across Nigeria.
	At the moment we are looking for a Social Media & Communications Officer – Lagos
	Are you a creative storyteller with a flair for digital strategy? This role is for you.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage all company social media platforms
	Design and distribute client-focused newsletters
	Support internal communications, branding, and campaign development
	Maintain and update the company website
	Contribute to content creation, including basic photography of products
	Innovate by integrating AI-tools into our communications strategy


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree with strong communication and writing skills
	Experience in social media management, digital content creation, and branding
	Eye for design and attention to detail
	Familiarity with content scheduling tools and analytics platforms.


Why Join Us?


	Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits
	Opportunity to grow within a thriving and meaningful industry
	Be part of a professional and innovative team
	Make a direct impact in transforming healthcare delivery


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: info@fftrading.biz using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant",
  "description": "Lington &amp; Bernie Consulting Limited was established on October 8, 1999 to provide efficient and qualitative consulting services to the oil and gas industry as well as banks and financial institutions in the areas of human resources placement and management, human resources consulting services, tax administration and payroll services as well as oil and gas fiscal and contractual terms advisory services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Omole, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and results-driven Accountant with proven experience in the construction industry. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing financial records, preparing accurate reports, ensuring compliance with statutory regulations, and supporting project cost controls.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate financial records and general ledgers.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
	Monitor and reconcile project expenditures, budgets, and cost allocations.
	Ensure compliance with tax regulations and statutory reporting requirements.
	Liaise with project managers to track the financial performance of ongoing projects.
	Oversee payroll, vendor payments, and receivables.
	Support internal and external audits.


Requirements
